coherence_artifact.answer:
﻿# Summary
This coherence run audits the Helmholtz guided-vs-unguided ΔΨ comparator artifacts produced by UCC:
comparison.json/.md, delta_curve.csv, and audit_bundle.json.

# Assumptions
- Toy experiment; proxy coherence only; not a physics claim.
- Audit improves traceability; it is not a truth guarantee.

# Limitations
- Comparator summarizes a specific input summary CSV; results depend on that artifact.
- ΔS/Λ are proxy stability checks on paraphrases.

# Uncertainty
- If the comparator outputs change, rerun this audit.

# Disclosure
Research scaffold only. Report issues via GitHub.

# Results
The comparator records ΔΨ_start/peak/end, AUC(ΔΨ), and pass/fail flags in comparison.json and binds provenance in audit_bundle.json.

claims.text: comparison.json records steps_count, t_start/t_end, and the headline ΔΨ metrics (start/peak/end) plus AUC(ΔΨ).
overall_pass is true only when pass_start, pass_peak, pass_end, and pass_auc satisfy the module thresholds.
delta_curve.csv contains the per-step ΔΨ(guided − unguided) sequence that the report summarizes.
audit_bundle.json binds the run to a git_commit and includes sha256 hashes for module + inputs/outputs (provenance).
The module YAML and sample task define the comparator configuration and are part of the reproducibility chain.

items.description: Coherence metrics are proxies; not a truth guarantee.

exceptions.process: Document exception, assign acceptor, set expiry, review on cadence.

coherence_artifact.question: Audit Helmholtz artifacts
